definition: A metacognitive process where an agent chooses between alternative strategies or methods for solving a task or pursuing a goal.

positive_examples: Given the time pressure, I decided to use a heuristic instead of full search.
The agent switched from a creative brainstorming mode to a strict rules-based mode.
She chose to double-check the calculation with a different method.
negative_examples: He followed the same routine as always without thinking about alternatives.
The algorithm ran a fixed pipeline with no configuration options.
They executed the plan exactly as written with no discussion.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not generic decision-making; specifically decisions about which cognitive or behavioral strategy to apply.
